cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between astral realms above and elemental realms below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Fewer planes: Material Plane, Transitive Planes, single Elemental Plane, Overheaven, and Underworld

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in complex orbits exerting greater influence the closer they draw to the Material Plane

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds on the Material Plane, plus the Feywild and Shadowfell as planar echoes.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: Boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes plus Para-elemental Planes, providing raw elemental substance.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen planes corresponding to alignments and philosophical differences.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing raw forces of life and death.

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty, fog-bound dimension whose shores overlap the Material Plane and Inner Planes, providing passage between them.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Misty fog-bound dimension. Border Ethereal visibility usually limited to 60 feet. Deep Ethereal visibility usually limited to 30 feet.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Ether cyclones appear abruptly as serpentine columns that spin through the plane, distorting and uprooting everything in their path.

timeFlow.description: Traveling through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. Distance is meaningless; travelers feel as if they can move by a simple act of will but it is impossible to measure speed and hard to track passage of time.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: An ether cyclone is a serpentine column that spins through the plane. The cyclone appears abruptly, distorting and uprooting everything in its path and carrying the debris for miles. Travelers with a Passive Perception score of 15 or higher receive 1 minute of warning: a deep thrum in the ethereal matter. Travelers who can't reach a curtain or portal leading elsewhere suffer the cyclone's effect.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Each character in a group traveling together makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw when the ether cyclone effect roll is 1-12 (Extended Journey). If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise, the journey's travel time is doubled.

onFailure.description: If fewer than half the group succeeds, the journey's travel time is doubled.

onSuccess.description: If at least half the group succeeds on the saving throw, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours instead of the journey's travel time being doubled.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter is perceived by travelers with a Passive Perception score of 15 or higher, giving 1 minute of warning before the cyclone arrives.

entries.description: Each character in a group traveling together makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise, the journey's travel time is doubled.
Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on the Ethereal Curtains table).
Hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

encounterProbability.description: Ether cyclones appear abruptly while traveling through the Ethereal Plane. No specific frequency is given; the DM determines when one occurs.

hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology, Ethereal Plane, Ether Cyclones

hazards.name: Keening Gloom
hazards.description: A massive ether cyclone known as the Keening Gloom whirls just beyond the Radiant Citadel in the Ethereal Plane. It is a looming threat and a grim reminder of the Radiant Citadel's precarious position. It functions as an ether cyclone but is a permanent, named fixture near the Radiant Citadel.
hazards.sourceReference: Chapter 6: Cosmology, Ethereal Plane, Radiant Citadel

planarConnections.name: Ethereal Curtains
planarConnections.description: Scattered throughout the Deep Ethereal are curtains of vaporous color. Passing through a curtain leads a traveler to a region of the Border Ethereal connected to a specific Inner Plane, the Material Plane, the Feywild, or the Shadowfell. The color of the curtain indicates the plane.

planarConnections.name: Ether Cyclone Astral Displacement
planarConnections.description: On a roll of 20 on the Ether Cyclone table, travelers are hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

planarConnections.name: Ether Cyclone Border Ethereal Displacement
planarConnections.description: On a roll of 13-19 on the Ether Cyclone table, travelers are blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane determined by rolling on the Ethereal Curtains table.

notableEntities.name: Radiant Citadel
notableEntities.description: A living relic of twenty-seven great civilizations on the Material Plane. A floating city carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond. The Keening Gloom ether cyclone whirls just beyond the city.

adventureThemes: Traveling between planes via the Deep Ethereal
Scouting and spying via the Border Ethereal

crossReferences.description: Several worlds accessible from the Radiant Citadel are introduced in this anthology of short adventures.

globalPlanarConnections.name: Ether Cyclone Planar Displacement
globalPlanarConnections.description: Ether cyclones in the Ethereal Plane can displace travelers to random locations in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (d20 roll 13-19) or hurl them to the Astral Plane (d20 roll 20). On rolls 1-12, travel time is extended via a DC 15 Charisma saving throw mechanic.
hazards: Extended journey with doubled travel time

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
